instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD: What is WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD? This is a signal from the keyboard for the left shift key, which is significantly different from the right shift key when it comes to resetting the SMC/PRAM. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no left shift function
threads.message:
Hi all,

got this in had liqued damage all cleaned and the thing was running fine,
now it came back, seems left shift wont work.
changed 3 keyboards, changed TP cable and TP

stil same... all works except left shift

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no left shift function
threads.message:
Why would you change the trackpad and cable? I really want to understand the reasoning behind this.

Left shift is a separate  key on pin 3 of the connector. Measure if it is pulled low when shift is pressed. I have a feeling left control and left option are also not working. Look at <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> circuit and understand how this works.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no left shift function
threads.message: mark as solved, seems the <SIGNAL>WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD</SIGNAL> had some trace damage\

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no left shift function
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 25565"]Why would you change the trackpad and cable? I really want to understand the reasoning behind this.

Left shift is a separate key on pin 3 of the connector. Measure if it is pulled low when shift is pressed. I have a feeling left control and left option are also not working. Look at <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> circuit and understand how this works.[/QUOTE]

because i wanted to make sure the trackpad/TPcable had no influence on this (yes they are separate on the board.so they should not)

.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no left shift function
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4850</CHIP> question, when pressing Left shift, <SIGNAL>WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD</SIGNAL> goes low <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> (wil send out signal on <SIGNAL>WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KEY</SIGNAL> (have not checked if this signal is high or low when not pressed/and pressed machine needs to get send out)
but if <SIGNAL>WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD</SIGNAL> goes low when pressed, and <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> wont send out any change and <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> does get <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> most likly is fucked

for this issue only <SIGNAL>WS_LEFT_SHIFT_KBD</SIGNAL> was affected
so <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> was good, when pressing the button it did go low at 1 side of the board. other side did nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no left shift function
threads.message: Look at <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> what else besides 3V42 needs to be present for the output to work?
